TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
I love these parts - they improve the game so much.

I am having a significant problem though. Most of the Tantares capsules aren't working properly - if you have Kerbals in them, they don't appear in the window view bottom right (the EVA/IVA view bit).

Is this known? Means I can't get Kerbals out once they're in. I've done this on a clean install with only Tantares and Tantares LV, on Win 8.1.

Specifically, the capsules are:

TK-DC03A

Almach Ballistic

V-C05 Operations Block

V-C2 Operations Block

V-C3 Operations Block

Spectre Crew Capsule

Maybe others too, haven't checked. Is this just because there's no IVA view, or by design (as in, there's no airlock)?

... in meanwhile, just add

INTERNAL

{

name = Placeholder

}

to all those pods without IVAs (the same way used in 0.90 to see crew on mk.3 Shuttle cockpit) to see kerbals on the crew windows...

I do it on my self editing any pod I found missing of internals

As anybody else experienced this bug with the gemini chute?

Also Gemini Aegena (or something like that) mission!

Well... I brought some more screenshots. This time from DMP, where me and VenomousRequiem are playing an international joint program with Soviet and US styled crafts. We have this little "Unity" Joint space station built with Tantares goodness:

Core module - "Unity" by VR; Soyuz, small "Sigma" shuttle and "Buran" (who brought the "Burya" lab module with a Clampotron/APAS docking port for American ships) by me.

Now, after the Buran flight VenomousRequiem decided to make a US space shuttle... It didn't turned out well on the maiden flight (my very first Burans also failed, though), so I was documenting the emergency landing from my MiG-15 jet:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Safe and sound the crew landed near the runway!

Um... No configs?

Ok, I see people talking about how Overpowered the launchers are, I'm not seeing it on the Soyuz. Even after my earlier problem of having the engines swapped, I'm having a problem getting things orbital. Standard Tantares Soyuz spacecraft, used one of the craft files on the front page. When the boosters drop off, I've still got over 2 minutes of fuel left in the sustainer stage, and not enough speed built up to keep ascending until the upper stage lights. Does the Soyuz require a shallower ascent? I've been using Mechjeb, and setting the profile at a 65 degree angle, leveling out at 70km.

The Proton on the other hand, has been driving me crazy because it's flipping mid flight. I'm pretty sure I have it pinned down to atmospheric drag, and have a much steeper and ascent profile, with less manuevering down low, and throttle down to 75-80% power through maxQ to keep the booster stage from "fishtailing" under 12km. After about 15 attempts, I finally managed to get another Mir module into orbit, only to accidently stage too early and have to revert the flight.

Beale I can't find your CLV parts ingame, I got the right folder in tantares LV ( unzipping it will give a CLV folder inside another one named CLV, that confused me first time I launched KSP ) Is this a normal issue ? How may I use your ariane Beta ?

Ghostshark27 -> I hope my PM could help you a bit

Be sure to make the most gentle curve and extent possible until the rocket is held back by the atmosphere especially with the proton, I keep my trajectory straight until I reach 23km for every booster

Okay thanks for the tip

Ok, I see people talking about how Overpowered the launchers are, I'm not seeing it on the Soyuz. Even after my earlier problem of having the engines swapped, I'm having a problem getting things orbital. Standard Tantares Soyuz spacecraft, used one of the craft files on the front page. When the boosters drop off, I've still got over 2 minutes of fuel left in the sustainer stage, and not enough speed built up to keep ascending until the upper stage lights. Does the Soyuz require a shallower ascent? I've been using Mechjeb, and setting the profile at a 65 degree angle, leveling out at 70km.

The Proton on the other hand, has been driving me crazy because it's flipping mid flight. I'm pretty sure I have it pinned down to atmospheric drag, and have a much steeper and ascent profile, with less manuevering down low, and throttle down to 75-80% power through maxQ to keep the booster stage from "fishtailing" under 12km. After about 15 attempts, I finally managed to get another Mir module into orbit, only to accidently stage too early and have to revert the flight.

The flipping will be the 1.0.2 aerodynamics, they suck completely as I am discovering (I'm not adding fins to my rockets, they shouldn't need fins!).

As for the general feedback, many thanks. It seems there are some TWR issues with the Soyuz rocket in particular.

I'm the only one having problem with the parachute?The Tantares one does'nt work.They deploy but the ship does'nt slow down.

Try deleting the partdatabase.cfg from the KSP root directory

Okay thanks for the tip

Okay!

Yes I accidentally uploaded the working models folder for Ariane

Here is the in-game parts!

Apologies!

It worked

Thanks Beale.

Okay, L'Ariane. 1.0.2, 20-ton NRAP.

First of all: it's TOTALLY overpowered, especially boosters. Its ASL TWR is almost 3(!) at 100% thrust. I've tweaked boosters to 50%, and the engine to 80%. In such config, it flies very nice and smooth - no flips and such (at least with this ascend profile).

With 20-ton NRAP, it lacks about 500 m\s dV for 100x100 orbit - shouldn't be a problem if you have an upper stage (I think Blok-D would make a perfect match!).

Anyway, it's a very good rocket, especially useful for light but wide payloads.

Small bug(?): boosters tend to collide after separating.

Here is the in-game parts!

Okay

Ariane is really great looking, and very powerful, I guess I shouldn't fly it with light payloads..
